column4: the /home/ partition is full or is /home/ not on its own partition?
/home is full
there is a 5% reserved you can reduce for a little extra space ;) but sounds like its time to clean out stuff
yeah.. i should but from where can i remove stuff if i'm logged in as guest
ive never seen one not able to login with home full. you can try logging in at the console
i tried .. it just reverts back to the login prompt only
makes me wonder if theres not a deeper issue.
ctrl+alt+f1 did the trick
could always reboot into the recovery/rescue mode i guess and look around
console worked.. thats a good sign ;)
check df -h       to see what is 'full' and how big things are. :)
yeah doing that..
df  -h says /home -> 0% free
how big is the home partition?
140G <-- /home
so by default about 5% or 5gb  is reserved ;) you can use the tune2fs command to reduce that %
or just clean out stuff
ok
but for now i am deleting some data i dont need
lets see if it works
check the cache and tmp dirs ;)
i forget how to show/short dirs by size used.
ok deleting a 21G vm disk did the fix ;-)
